page.title: 15FIGHELDEAN IN 54 YEARS.
page.content: The school caretaker,{Mrs Lewis, moved to{Figheldean}as a child. In those days,{1930,}there was no mains water, no main sewage disposal and{no electricity.}Today the villagers have the benefit of all these amenities and also pedestrian street lights for the dark winter nights. { There is a general store with a post {office counter but there used to be {four shops}including a{blacksmith, a {baker, a grocer and a separate post {office. There is also a public house {and a Working Men's Club.}The Club is new. Some of the houses, several with thatched roofs, are very old and have changed little but there has been a lot of new dwellings on the eastern side,most of them bungalows.
